## product description
 SES products mainly serve the intelligent electric vehicle Internet of Things industry, and provide customers with convenient and fast service, the principle of customer first.
 - SoftwareasaService software as a service, referred to as SaaS system. It is an Internet of Things information service platform independently developed by RedEGroup through the combination of Internet information technology and smart energy vehicles.
 - RedE's internal intelligent office management system, referred to as ROS, is a management tool based on the "customer relationship management system" business model, which is independently developed by the company and is only used for internal office use.
 - App based on RedESaaS system and smart vehicle SCS. It is an Internet of Things product focusing on the distribution industry, combining Internet technology with smart cars.
  
## Purpose
 - SasS system, which provides enterprise-level customers with integrated management, analysis, online ordering, distribution, one-click distribution, navigation, cycling, and supervision as a whole. Customers do not need to purchase hardware, build a computer room, download applications, and recruit IT staff to use it through the Internet.
 - RedE's internal intelligent office management system helps all internal staff to complete all daily tasks intelligently, efficiently, and conveniently, solves the user's pain points of traditional manual or repetitive labor of office staff, and realizes the efficient use of information resources, thereby maximizing Limit the improvement of work efficiency and quality. Collects and analyzes all offline business, platform, information, visualization, standardization, using modern Internet technology to provide accurate, credible and evidence-based data
 - Based on the RedESaaS system and the APP used in the smart vehicle SCS, enterprise customers can create several riders through the SaaS platform to use the APP. Riders can use the APP to achieve remote control and supervision of vehicles, and the order delivery, statistics and seamless docking.

## range
  This document is based on the requirements of the RedE market, reorganizing and confirming the establishment. 
  Mainly used as the basis for product requirements, system prototypes, version iterations, business processes, and logic descriptions.
  
## Document usage
 Mainly product team, design team, technical team, test team, operation and marketing team.
 
### 1. Technical Selection

- Language framework
	- JDK 1.8
	- Spring Boot 2.1.9.RELEASE
    - Spring Security
    - Spring security Oauth2
    - Spring Security OAuth2 SSO
	- Dubbo 2.7.3
	- Zookeeper 3.4.9
	- Redis 2.9.0
	- Poi 4.1.0
	- MySQL
	- Mybatis Plus  3.1.2
	- Swagger 2.8.0
	- Xxl job 
	- TX-LCN分布式事务框架
- Build tools
	- Intellij IDEA Ultimate 2019.2
	- Maven
- System
	- Windows 10
	- Mac Os

### 3. project structure description

```text
ses-server
  ├── ses-api                                                           Interface API exposed layer
  │   ├── ses-api-common                                                RedE API public resources
  │   ├── ses-api-foundation                                            RedE underlying support
  │   ├── ses-api-hub                                                   RedE multiple data sources support AP
  │   ├── ses-api-mobile-b                                              RedE B-side mobile support
  │   ├── ses-api-mobile-c                                              RedE C-side mobile support
  │   ├── ses-api-proxy                                                 RedE three-party service bottom layer
  │   └── ses-api-scooter                                               RedE Vehicle API
  ├── ses-app                                                           Application layer
  │   ├── ses-admin-dev                                                 RedE Development Management Platform
  │   ├── ses-app-common                                                RedE Application Public Resources
  │   ├── ses-mobile-client                                             RedE mobile service support
  │   ├── ses-web-delivery                                              RedE SaaS Management System
  │   ├── ses-web-repair                                                RedE Maintenance Management System
  │   └── ses-web-ros                                                   RedE internal management system
  ├── ses-doc                                                           rede documentation
  ├── ses-job                                                           Distributed timing task
  │   ├── doc                                                           Distributed scheduled task file
  │   ├── ses-job-admin                                                 Distributed management platform
  │   ├── ses-job-core                                                  Distributed Task Core
  │   └── ses-job-executor                                              Task executor
  ├── ses-monitor-admin                                                 rede monitoring system
  ├── ses-service                                                       Producer service provider layer
  │   ├── ses-service-base                                              Underlying infrastructure services
  │   │   ├── ses-service-proxy                                         Tripartite foundation support
  │   │   ├── ses-service-scooter                                       Vehicle basic services
  │   │   └── ses-service-foundation                                    SaaS underlying infrastructure services
  │   ├── ses-service-common                                            Service layer public resources
  │   ├── ses-service-hub                                               Multi-data source scheduling platform
  │   ├── ses-service-mobile-b                                          B-side mobile service support
  │   ├── ses-service-mobile-c                                          C-side mobile service support
  │   └── ses-service-security                                          Permission security
  ├── ses-starter                                                       rede component layer
  │   ├── ses-starter-common                                            RedE base dependencies
  │   ├── ses-starter-db                                                Database components
  │   ├── ses-starter-dubbo                                             dubbo RPC component
  │   ├── ses-starter-logs                                              Log component
  │   ├── ses-starter-poi                                               Table component
  │   ├── ses-starter-redis                                             Redis cache component
  │   └── ses-starter-swagger                                           swagger online documentation component
  ├── ses-tool                                                          Public tools
  └── ses-txlcn-manager                                                 Distributed transaction management
```

### 6. Packaging

1. maven Multi-environment packaging commands
```shell script
mvn clean package -Dmaven.test.skip=true -Pprod
```

### 7. Git branch specifications
Branch naming
* master branch
```text
The master branch is also the branch used to deploy the production environment to ensure the stability of the master branch
The master branch is generally merged by develop and hotfix branches. You cannot modify the code directly at any time.
```


* develop branch
```text
develop is the development branch, always keeping the latest completed and bug fixed code
When new features are generally developed, the feature branch is created based on the develop branch
```


* feature branch
```text
When developing new features, create feature branches based on develop
Branch naming: feature / begins with feature branch, naming rules: feature / user_module, feature / cart_module

```

* release branch
```text
Release is a pre-launch branch. During the release and testing phase, the release branch code is used as a benchmark for testing.

When a group of feature development is completed, it will first be merged into the develop branch. When entering the test, a release branch will be created.
If there are bugs that need to be fixed during the test, the developers will fix and submit them directly in the release branch.
After the test is completed, merge the release branch into the master and develop branches. At this time, the master is the latest code and is used for going online.
```

* hotfix branch
```text
Branch naming: hotfix / begins with a repair branch, and its naming rules are similar to feature branches
When an emergency problem occurs online, you need to fix it in time. Use the master branch as the baseline and create a hotfix branch. After the repair is completed, you need to merge it into the master branch and develop branch.
```

* Basic syntax of Commit messages
The more widely used in the industry is the Angular Git Commit Guidelines
The specific format is:
```git
<type>: <subject>
<BLANK LINE>
<body>
<BLANK LINE>
<footer>
```

> - type: type of this commit, such as bugfix docs style, etc.
> - scope: the scope of this commit
> - subject: Concisely explain the main purpose of this commit, with a few points highlighted in the original text. 1. Use imperative sentences, is it a familiar or unfamiliar word, to convey the imperatives in the portal 2. Do not capitalize the first letter 3. No punctuation required at the end
> - body: Also use imperative sentences. In the main content, we need to describe this commit in detail. For example, the motivation of this change. If you need to wrap, use |
> - footer: describe the issue or break change associated with it, see the case for details

Type category description:

> - feat: add new features
> - fix: fix bug
> - docs: only modified documentation
> - style: only the spaces, formatting indentation, all are good, etc., without changing the code logic
> - refactor: code refactoring, no new features or bug fixes
> - perf: add code for performance testing
> - test: add test case
> - chore: change the build process, or add dependent libraries, tools, etc.
